org.eclipse.dataset

Interface IDynamicDataset

  • All Superinterfaces:
    ILazyDataset, IMetadataProvider, INameable, java.io.Serializable
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    ILazyWriteableDataset, IRemoteDataset
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    LazyDynamicDataset, LazyWriteableDataset

    public interface IDynamicDataset
extends ILazyDataset
    This interface is intended for data sources that change dynamically. Examples: 1. An image stream from a camera encoded which entire image, changes periodically. 2. An HDF5 dataset which entire shape changes as data is added.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int UNLIMITED
      Denotes an unlimited dimension in maximum shape

      • resize

        void resize(int... newShape)
        Change shape
        Parameters:
        newShape -
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if new shape exceeds maximum shape or is of different rank
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - if used on a view

      • startUpdateChecker

        void startUpdateChecker(int milliseconds,
                        IDatasetChangeChecker checker)
        Starts a periodic checker to see if dataset has changed in some manner. If any potential changes are detected after the period has finished then registered listeners are alerted. A period of 0 or less with stop any existing checker.
        Parameters:
        milliseconds - period between checks in milliseconds
        checker - can be null for default implementation of alerting listeners unconditionally

      • fireDataListeners

        void fireDataListeners()
        Alert any registered listeners
